question: 1 In a class of 80 students, 60% passed in Economics and only 20% passed in History. The number of students who neither passed in Economics nor in History are:?
2 A sum of ₹ 1518 is divided among A, B, and C, such that A receives 20% more than B and B receives 20% less than C. What is the share of C in the sum?
3 If 40% of a number is 105 more than the one-fourth of that number, then what will be the difference between the number and 35% of the number?

4 The price of an article increases by 15% every year. If at the end of the third year and the fourth year the difference of its values is Rs. 193.20, then which was 90% of its value at the end of the second year:?

5 In an examination, there are three subjects 'A', 'B' and 'C', A student has to pass in each subject. 20% students failed in 'A', 22% students failed in 'B' and 16% students failed in 'C'. The total number of students passing the whole examination lies between :?
6 If A is 20% less than B, then what will be the value of (2B - A) / A ?
7 Two numbers are 20% and 25% respectively lesser than a third number. By how much percent is the second number to be enhanced to make it equal to the first number?
8 If 40% of 2/5 of a number is 24, then the number is:?
9 The sum of incomes of A and B is Rs. 165000. A spends 70% and B spends 80% of their incomes. If savings of A is 25% more than that of B, then what is the difference between their incomes?
10 The price of cooking oil increased by 25%. Find by how much percentage a family must reduce its consumption in order to maintain the same budget.?
11 Ravi scores 72% marks in examinations. If these are 360 marks, the maximum marks are:?
12 Anu spends 68% of her monthly income. If her monthly income increases by 20% and her monthly saving increase by 9 38 % then the percentage increase in her monthly expenditure is:  ?
13  By what number must the given number be multiplied to increase the number by 25%. ?

14  An examination was held on five subjects where the maximum marks for each subject was 100. X scored 82, 97, 88 and 91 in four subjects. If his aggregate was 90%, how much did he score in the fifth subject?
15  In an examination, Anita scored 31% marks and failed by 16 marks. Sunita scored 40% marks and obtained 56 marks more than those required to pass. Find the minimum marks required to pass.?

16  In a school, 4% of the students did not appear for the annual exams. 10% of the students who appeared for the exams could not pass the exam. Out of the remaining students, 50% got distinction marks and 432 students passed the exam but could not get distinction marks. The total number of students in the school is:  ?
17  A man spends 75% of his income. His income increases by 20% and his expenditure also increases by 10%. Find the percentage increase in his savings. ?

18   In an examination 73% of the candidates passed in quantitative aptitude test, 70% passed in General awareness and 64% passed in both. If 6300 failed in both subjects the total number of examinees were  ?
19  A businessman’s earnings increase by 25% in one year but decreases by 4% in the next. Going by this pattern, after 5 years, his total earnings would be Rs. 72000. What is his present earning?
20  What % of a day is 30 minutes?
21  25 litres of a mixture contain 30% of spirit and rest water. If 5 litres of water be mixed in it, the percentage of spirit in the new mixture is:  ?

22  An army lost 10% of its men in war, 10% of the remaining died due to disease and 10% of the rest were declared disabled. Thus the strength of the army was reduced to 7,29,000 active men. The original strength of the army was  ?

23  A scored 72% in a paper with maximum marks of 900 and 80% in another paper with maximum marks of 700. If the result is based on the combined percentage of two papers, the combined percentage is  ?
24  A Village lost 12% of its goats in a flood and 5% of remainder died from diseases. If the number left now is 8360. What was the original number before the flood?
25  A number is increased by 20%. To get back to the original number, the increased number is to be reduced by  ?
26  By what fraction selling price (S. P.) must be multiplied to get the cost price (C. P.) if the loss is 20%?
27  The population of a city increased by 30% in the first year and decreased by 15% in the next year. If the present population is 11,050 then population 2 years ago was:  ?

28  On a certain date, Pakistan has a success rate of 60% against India in all the ODIs played between the two countries. They lost the next 30 ODIs in a row to India and their success rate comes down to 30%. The total number of ODIs played between the two countries is  ?
29  A man spend 7 % of his money and after spending 75% of the remaining, he had Rs. 370 left. How much money did he have?
30 A line of length 1.5 metres was measured as 1.55 metres by mistake. What will be the value of error percent?
31  The price of sugar is increased by 20% By what percentage must one cut down on the consumption of sugar so that no extra amount has to be incurred on sugar?
32  A and B spend 60% and 75% of their incomes, respectively. If the savings of A are 20% more than that of B, then by what percentage is the income of A less than the income of B?

33  In an examination in which the full marks were 500, A scored 25% more marks than B, B scored 60% more marks than C and C scored 20% less marks than D. If A scored 80% marks, then the percentage of marks obtained by D is:  ?

34  A, B and C donate 8%, 7% and 9%, of their salaries, respectively to a charitable trust. The salaries of A and B are same and the different between their donations is Rs. 259. The total donation of A and B is Rs. 1,185 more than that of C. the total donation of A and C is what percentage of the total salaries of A, B and C (Correct to one decimal place)?
35  A boy found the answer to the question 'Subtract the sum of 1/4 and 1/5 from unity and express the answer in decimals' as 0.45. The percentage of error in his answer was?

36  Sonu saves 15% of her income. If her income increases by 20% and she still saves the same amount as before, then what is the percentage increase in her expenditure(correct to one decimal place)  ?

37  Two bottles of the same capacity are 35% and 33 1/3% full of orange juice, respectively they are filled up completely with apple juice and then the contents of both bottles are emptied into another vessel. The percentage if apple juice in the mixture is:  ?
38  The price of a machine got depreciated by 50% in the 1st year, 33 1/3% in the 2nd year and 25% in the 3rd year. Overall, by how much has the machine depreciated?
39  The number of seats in a cinema hall is increased by 20% and the price of a ticket is also increased by 8%. What is the percentage increase in the revenue collected?
40  A and B obtained 441 marks and 558 marks respectively. If B got 62% marks, the percentage of marks obtained by A is: ?
41  A is 60% more than B, C is 35% less than D and D is 30% more than A, which of the following is true?

42  Sonu decides to donate 12% of her monthly income to a charitable trust. On the day of donation, she changed her decision and donates a sum Rs. 2160 which is equal to 125% of what she decided to donate earlier. Her monthly income is:  ?
43  A number is first increased by 16 2/3% and then decreased by 15% to get 238. What is 37.5% of that number?
44  A student scored 32% marks and failed by 6 marks. Had the scored 36%, he would have passed by 2 marks. What is the passing score?
45  In an examination, there are 800 boys and 600 girls. 40% boys and 60% girls passed the examination. The percentage (correct to two decimal places) of failed students from the total students is: ?
46  Manish’s salary is half of Ravi’s salary. Ravi’s salary is how much percentage more than Manish’s Salary?
47  A is 25% more than B while B is 20% less than C and C is 10% more than D. Which of the following is not true?
48  The population of a village one year ago was 72,000. Due to migration it decreases at the rate of 8% per annum. What is its present population?
49  If (x + 10)% of 200 is 33.33% more than x% of 180, then 10% of (x + 20) is what percent less than 40% of x?
50  A shopkeeper wrongly calculates his profit on the selling of an article and finds it to be 40%. What is his actual profit percentage?

51  In an examination, 40% of the students who appeared were boys and rest were girls. The pass percentage of the boys was 60% and overall pass percentage was 56%. What was the pass percentage of the girls?
52  What is the value of 12.5% of 30% of 1440?
53  A number is first increased by 20% and then reduced by 15%. If the final value is 2040, then what is the initial value of the number?

55  The total marks for a subject in an examination was 200. It had three components- theory, practical and project, the percentage weightages for the first and the third being 50 and 10 respectively. One of the criteria to pass the examination was to secure at least 60%, in practical. A student secured 42 in practical. How much percentage of the total marks should be given to him as grace so that he passes to exam?
56  A is 20% more than B. B is 25% more than C. C is how much percent less than A?
57 12.5% of A = 55. What is the value of A ?
58  A is 20% more than B, which is 25% less than C. Which of the following is true about A and C?

59  When the price of sugar increased by 28%, a family reduced its consumption per month such that the expenditure on sugar was only 12% more than before. If 10 kg sugar was consumed per month before the price rise, then what was the new consumption?
60  Anita spends 68% of her monthly income. If her monthly income increases by 40% and the expenditure increase by 30%, then by what percent does her saving increase?
61  A number is first increased by 40% and then it is increased by 30%. What is the net percentage increase?
62  A is 15% more than B. B is how much percent (correct up to two decimal places) less than A?
63  A man spends 10% of his salary on food. He spends 20% of the remaining part on fuel. If he is left with Rs. 4680, then what is his salary?
64  If 3.4% of 600 × 2.5% of x = 382.5, then the value of x is: ?
65  There are 1550 boys and girls in a school. The number of girls exceeds the number of boys by 500. What is the percentage (to the nearest integer) of girls in the school?
66  What percentage of 5.6 kg is 140 gram?

67  In an exam, A gets 20% less than the passing marks and B gest 20% more than passing marks. If the sum of marks obtained by A and B is equal to maximum marks, what is the ratio of passing marks to maximum marks?
68  If 40% of x equal 50% of y, then find the value of y : x ?
69  Daily ticket of a metro train costs Rs. 120 and Monthly pass costs Rs. 3276. If Sohan buys the Monthly pass and travels for 30 days in a month then what Percentage does the save?
70  Shiv purchased a table for Rs. 135000 and sold it for Rs. 110000 what is loss percentage?

71  Aman’s annual income has increased by Rs. 20 lakhs but the tax on income that he has to pay has reduced from 20% to 16%. He now pays the same amount of tax as earlier. What is his new total income (in Rs. lakhs)?
72  The number of tables that can be purchased by a person in Rs. 2800 gets reduced by 20 if the price is increased by 40%. What is the initial price of each table?
73  320 is how much percentage less than 400?
74  Rahul’s salary is 40% less than Rakesh’s salary. Deepak’s salary is 80% more than Rahul’s salary. If Deepak’s salary is Rs. 34560, then what is the salary of Rakesh?
73  60% of a number is 168, then what is the number?
76  If A is 200% more than B, then B is how much percentage less than A?
77  If 80% of X is 36 more than 60% of Y and 120% of X is equal to Y, then the difference between X and Y is: ?

78  When the price of sugar gets raised by 20%, a person increases his expenditure on sugar only by 12%. By what percentage (correct up to two decimal places) should he reduce his consumption of sugar so as to be able to maintain the same level of expenditure?
80  A person can save 25% of his income. If his income increases by 20% and still he saves the same amount as before, the percentage increase in his expenditure is ______. ?
81  The difference between the 38% of a number and 22% of that number is 3200. What is the 15 1/2 % of that number?

82  The population of town B is 300% more than that of town A. For the next two years, the population of A increases by x% per year and that of B decreases by the same percentage per year. After 2 years, if the population of A and B becomes equal, then the value of x is ______. ?
83  A is 75% less than B and C is 75% of the difference between A and B. C is what percentage more than A?

85  If 66 2/3% of 75% of one-eighth of a certain number is 179, then 33 1/3% of three-fourth of that number is: ?
86  A is 40% more than B and B is 60% less than C. If C is 60% more than D, then which of the following is true?

87  In an office, 70% of the total number of employees are females. 80% of the total number of employees, including 35 males, got promotion. If there are 105 female employees, then what percentage of female employees got promotion?

88  The total number of males and females in a town is 70,000. If the number of males is increased by 6% and that of the females is increased by 4%, then the total numbers of males and females in the town would become 73520. What is the difference between the number of males and females in the town, in the beginning?

89  In school, 60% of the number of students are boys and the rest are girls. If 20% of the number of boys failed and 65% of the number of girls passed the examination, then the percentage of the total number of students who passed is:  ?
90  If A is 48% more than B and C is 60% less than the sum of A and B, then A is what percentage more than C  (Correct to one decimal place.) ?

91  In a test consisting of 140 questions, a candidate correctly answered 70% of the first 80 questions.What percentage of the remaining question does the candidate need to correctly answer to score 60% in the test?
92  A is 40% less than B, and C is 40% of the sum of A and B. The difference between A and B is what percentage of C?
93  A man spends 2/3rd of his income. If his income increases by 14% and the expenditure increases by 20%. Then the percentage increase in his savings will be ?

94  During an election where only two contestants A and B competes, initially when voters’ turnout was 70%, A got 33 1/3% more votes than B. After some time, when the voters’ turnout was 80%, A got 10 10/19% more than B. What percentage of the voters who voted after 70% turnout voted for B?

95  Sudha decided to donate 18% of her monthly income to an orphanage. On the day of donation, she changed her decision and donated a sum of Rs. 5400 which was equal to 75% of what she had decided earlier. What is 33% of her monthly income?
96  If A’s income is 40% of B’s income and B’s income is 24% more than C’s income, then by what percentage is C’s income more than A’s income (Your answer should be correct to one decimal place.) ?

97  When the price of sugar increased by 28%, a family reduced its consumption per month such that the expenditure on sugar was only 12% more than the earlier one. If the family consumed 18.4 kg of sugar per month earlier, then what is its new consumption of sugar per month?
98  If the word PHOTOGRAPH is spelled with ‘F’ in place of ‘PH’, then what would be the percentage reduction in the number of letters?

99  The monthly salary of a person was Rs. 50,000. He used to spend on three heads- personal and family expenses (E), taxes (T), philanthropy (P), and rest were his savings. E was 50% of the income, T was 20% of E and P was 15% of T. When his salary got raised by 40%, he maintained the percentage level of E, but T became 30% of E and P became 20% of T. By what percentage is the new savings more or less than the earlier savings  (correct up to one decimal place)?
100  Monika spends 72% of her income. If her income increases by 20% and savings increase by 15%, then her expenditure increases by: (correct to 1 decimal place) ?

119  If A is 28% more than B and C is 25% less than the sum of A and B, then by what percent will C be more than A (correct to one decimal place)?
